item.title: Report X-2023081544
item.description:
Report X-2023081544

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-16
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being loaded onto van. package was isolated and cleanup procedures were performed after manager called for trained personnel. DescribePack: puncture on the outside near the top causing contents to spill. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was isolated and absorbent pads were used to cleanup contents that spilled out.

item.title: Report X-2023081104
item.description:
Report X-2023081104

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The hazardous material drum was being unloaded off of a P&D vehicle, when a package handler noticed liquid gathering at the rim of the closure. The package handler did not touch the drum and immediately brought to the attention of a QA Admin and Ops Manager. Proper PPE was obtained, and the drum was moved to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid of the drum was improperly sealed or was not the correct size. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The drum was immediately moved to a flat surface away from the operation.

item.title: Report X-2023081027

Report X-2023081027

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PD-1 DA SLIDE, WORE REQUIRED PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT (PPE), FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, CLEANED UP AND REMOVED THE SPILL SAFELY.

item.title: Report X-2023080876
item.description:
Report X-2023080876

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was taken out of system flow due to noted spillage, upon inspection of inner contents, the cap on the container was loose causing spillage, due to the spillage the container was soiled. DescribePack: Loose cap. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: The damaged package and contents were placed in a lined hazmat tote to mitigate spillage.

item.title: Report X-2023080838
item.description:
Report X-2023080838

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: CERTIFIED PERSONNEL CALLED ABOUT A WET DISTRESSED PACKAGE. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE. DescribePack: HAZMAT WAS REPACKED AT PREVIOUS LOCATION IN AN IMPROPER SIZED BOX AND INSUFFICIENT INNER PACKING ALLOWING MOVEMENT ALLOWING LIQUID RELEASE TO OCCUR FROM DESPENSE CAP. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: WET BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE AND TAKEN TO HMPA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023080828
item.description:
Report X-2023080828

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: pkg was found during the load process on 8-9 at 05:30 and taken to qa for inspection. DescribePack: plastic jerrican was punctured on the bottom and leaking. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe used to place jerrican in numerous hazmat bags and then into a plastic tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon the unloading of the trailer, package was placed on conveyor were a trainer had noticed a small white solid leaking from a package on the trailer. Trainer stopped the conveyor and called a manager who then alerted QA to come and perform research regarding corrosive nature of the contents and perform cleanup procedures, DescribePack: no package failure DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: conveyor was stopped on notice of package leaking contents. Package was isolated and upon retrieving SDS, proper cleanup procedures were done

item.title: Report E-2023080889
item.description:
Report E-2023080889

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-05T15:12:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-15
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 16, 2023, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN3266 was punctured by a forklift and released its full contents to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel deployed absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew further deployed a degreasing agent and wiped the surfaces with absorbent pads. All UN3266-impacted material was containerized in two (2) 35-gallon drums for disposal.

Report E-2023080539

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A metal tote containing residual mineral spirits released onto the trailer floor, onto the dock, and underneath the trailer. A total of (3) gallons released. There aren't any visible punctures on the tote. It was apparent the release came from the valve. A contractor cleaned the impacted areas with spill pads.
